Award.AwardTitle: EAPSI: Dye sensitized solar cell coatings to improve charge transport

POR.DRECONTENT:
Solar cells are one of the most promising forms of alternative energy. Not only do they produce clean energy, they help the US remain independent of foreign energy sources. Due to the varying amount of power collected throughout the day, solar cells are coupled with battery storage devices so the power can be drawn as needed. By continuing to increase the efficiency of these devices, the technology will become more competitive and less expensive on a per kilowatt-hour basis.

The purpose of my trip stems from the shifting focus of my research group at the University of Florida, under Dr. Sigmund. The focus has been shifting to energy storage and conversion technologies. It was my goal to visit our collaborating groups at Hanyang University, S. Korea, under Dr. Kang, and Dr. Paik. These groups are already well established in the area, which gave me the opportunity to gain further insight and perspective into this field of research. During my stay I became familiar with new technologies and collaborated on several solar cell and battery storage related projects. This project resulted in the submission of a manuscript, which is currently under review. The manuscript discusses the synthesis of a novel nanostructured solar cell, which exhibits enhanced light harvesting and a high open circuit voltage.

This experience has been particularly helpful for me to grow as a researcher. The EAPSI program provided me with access to equipment and expertise that I would not have had access to otherwise. Furthermore, it has allowed me to experience a vastly different culture, which has greatly expanded my worldview, and given me insight into the challenges one must overcome as a foreigner. Finally, it was an excellent networking opportunity. Not only did I establish contacts and friendships with my Korean collaborators, I also established contacts with many US researchers from a larger variety of fields who also took part in the EAPSI program.
